title: Add username/password authentication to admin dashboard

requirements.text: Add a backend mechanism to store and verify a hardcoded or configurable admin username and password. Expose a function (e.g., `verifyAdminCredentials(username: Text, password: Text) : async Bool`) that returns true if the credentials match. Store the credentials securely in stable state (hashed or as a stable variable). Provide a default username and password that can be changed by the owner.

quotes: use username and password to access admin dash board

acceptanceCriteria: A backend function exists that accepts a username and password and returns a boolean indicating success or failure.
Default credentials are defined and functional.

requirements.text: Replace or augment the current admin dashboard access flow (currently guarded by `OwnerGuard` / `useOwnerAuth`) with a username and password login screen. When a user navigates to the admin dashboard route, show a centered login form with username and password fields and a 'Login' button before granting access to the dashboard. On successful credential verification via the backend, store a session flag (e.g., in React state or sessionStorage) and render the dashboard. On failure, display an inline error message ('Invalid username or password'). Include a 'Logout' button inside the dashboard that clears the session and returns to the login screen.

quotes: use username and password to access admin dash board

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the admin dashboard shows a login form instead of the dashboard when not authenticated.
Entering correct credentials grants access to the full admin dashboard.
Entering incorrect credentials shows an error message and does not grant access.
A logout button is visible in the dashboard and clears the session, redirecting back to the login screen.
Page refresh while session is active keeps the user logged in (via sessionStorage).
The login form is visually consistent with the existing dark theme of the application.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts.
Do not remove Internet Identity authentication from other parts of the app â€” only the admin dashboard access flow is affected.
The admin login session must be frontend-only (sessionStorage or React state); do not create new backend session/token management beyond credential verification.
nonGoals: Replacing Internet Identity login for regular users.
Multi-user admin accounts or role management.
Password reset or email-based recovery flows.
Encrypting passwords with external cryptographic libraries.
